intro: Lathyrus vernus subsp. flaccidus, commonly known as the slender vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its slender, often sprawling stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of purple or pink, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnate, with three to five leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Lathyrus vernus subsp. flaccidus is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
